the People/Wisconsin: Who We Are Tim Kelley Jan 6, 2012 Jan 6, 2012 Updated May 7, 2012 0 Facebook Twitter Bluesky WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save We the People/Wisconsin is a multi-media partnership that aims to reconnect citizens with public life through town hall meetings, candidate and issue forums and citizen-based reporting. The non-profit coalition includes the Wisconsin State Journal, Wisconsin Public Television, Wisconsin Public Radio, WISC-TV (CBS, Madison), WisPolitics.com and Wood Communications Group. We the People/Wisconsin produces timely forums so that citizens can question political candidates, public officials - and themselves. It does not advocate for any candidate, political party or movement. It advocates for readers, viewers and listeners by serving as a channel for conversations between citizens and public officials throughout Wisconsin. Why does We the People/Wisconsin exist? Many citizens feel issues they care about and questions they need answered are not addressed by politicians. Many of those same citizens also feel the media does not cover these issues or questions - and even enable politicians to avoid them. We the People's goal is to ensure citizens' concerns are discussed fully and their questions answered, by devising forums in which these concerns are addressed by both politicians and the media. People are also reading… Wisconsin’s Powerball jackpot winners and how much they won Bankruptcy to leave large retail space empty in Madison John Nolen Drive reconstruction starts next month. Here’s what to know 16-story student apartment building proposed near State Street City, developer clash over partly demolished building on West Wilson Street Former Green Bay Packers QB cited after bar altercation in Eau Claire UW-Madison parents hire surrogate mom to care for students at college Survivors group says Madison Diocese ignored complaints against priest accused of sex crimes WIAA moves state high school team wrestling tournament out of Madison Restaurant reviews: Back for seconds, a look at 4 recently visited spots Which Madison schools saw the most police calls last year? 2 Marquette men's lacrosse players killed in crash near campus 5 must-see Wisconsin state parks to visit this fall Madison says GPA determines who gets automatic admission to UW, regardless of number of students Attorney who represented murderer Barbara Hoffman dies at 92 How does We the People/Wisconsin do this? Since 1992, We the People has enlisted partners from all segments of the media: print, radio, television and online. With the help of these dedicated partners, We the People holds focus groups, conducts polls, and does interviews with citizens to see what issues and questions they believe should be discussed, and then establishes forums, such as debates between political candidates to ensure these issues and questions receive attention from politicians and the media. 0 Comments Be the first to know Get local news delivered to your inbox! Applying the Brand on Social Media – Brand and Visual Identity – UW–Madison Skip to main content U niversity of W isconsin –Madison UW Crest Brand and Visual Identity UW–Madison's official brand guide Search Menu open menu close Home About the Brand Expand Collapse Brand Platform Brand Messaging Commitment to Diversity Contact Us Visual Identity Expand Collapse Logos Colors Typography Graphic Elements & Icons Photography Videography Applying the Brand Expand Collapse Print Web Social Media Email Stationery & Promotional Items Tools & Templates Inspiration Brand Aid Video Series On Brand Newsletter Home Applying the Brand Applying the Brand on Social Media Applying the Brand on Social Media Social media platforms provide a great opportunity to engage your audiences and promote the UW–Madison brand. The social media assets below can help you maintain a clear connection to the university on your accounts. Review our social media tips for more information on how to create and manage a social media account at UW–Madison. Branding guidelines Your profile avatar, account name, and bio work together to help users immediately identify that your content relates to UW–Madison. Avatars We recommend using one of the following options for your social media avatars. Your avatar will always appear alongside your profile name, so it’s unnecessary to repeat your unit name on the image. Universal avatars These versatile UW avatar designs can be used by any campus unit. Get the universal avatars Academic color avatars Select the avatar with the academic color for your school, college, or academic area. Get the academic color avatars Account names and bios Spell out your campus unit’s full name, preceded by UW–Madison , as your profile/account name. If your campus unit’s full name exceeds the word count allowed for profile names, consider using a common abbreviation (e.g., Dept. for Department, UW for UW–Madison ) and/or writing out the full name in your profile bio. Recognizing special occasions If you wish to recognize special occasions on your profile (such as program anniversaries or heritage months), we recommend leveraging the profile banner image. You can change your banner image as often as you’d like. Frequently changing your avatar risks breaking your clear connection to the university and users’ familiarity with your profile, creating avatars that are too difficult to read or inaccessible for screen readers, or breaking campus policy on logo usage. The UW Photo Library provides thousands of free, high-resolution images for campus use. You can include a photo credit in your profile bio. Social media templates Need a quick social post? We offer templates sized for Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and X. Options include text-, graphic-, and photo-forward designs for awards, events, spotlights, and rankings. Browse our collection of templates and customize them in Adobe InDesign. Get social media templates Optimize your social media presence Make it accessible and inclusive As you post on social media, you’ll want to take steps to keep your content accessible and inclusive. Review the Center for User Experience’s self-service guides on digital accessibility as well as the UW Inclusive Communications Guide to get started. Measure engagement with your content Learn what content is engaging your audiences by checking your social media analytics frequently. You can also UTM tag your links to measure the engagement your social media platforms are driving within your website. Get the UTM Link Builder Template . Learn from your peers #UWSocial is a group of communicators from schools, colleges, and departments across campus dedicated to sharing great social media content and resources for the UW–Madison community and beyond. Request to join the Facebook group or the email list . Looking for more resources? World War I Obituary Indexes Helpful Links Recommended Books Museum Contact Main Street Madison, NJ, from Waverly Place looking west Bottle Hill Tavern/Madison House 1922 About Us OUR MISSION: To collect, preserve, and share Madison’s rich history in a way that is accessible and relevant to all. Through our extensive collection of historical materials, engaging exhibits, community and educational programs, and events, we aim to inspire pride, curiosity, and a deeper understanding of our shared past. We strive to create a lasting legacy that fosters community connections and encourages ongoing exploration and learning for future generations. GET INVOLVED! OUR VISION: To be the trusted guardian and ambassador of Madison’s rich history, preserving the stories of our past and sharing them with present and future generations, in our community and beyond. We strive to inspire curiosity and pride in the community, and a lifelong passion for learning and discovery, through resource materials, engaging exhibits, educational programs, and community events that celebrate our heritage and honor the contributions of those who have shaped our town. As history continues to unfold, we strive to stay relevant and active, and to strengthen community bonds and create a sense of connection that transcends time. 2024-2025 Board Members ​​​President: Nancy Adamczyk Program Chair: Herm Huber Corresponding Secretary: Noreen McManus Recording Secretary: Claudia Johnson Treasurer: Dave Luber Custodian: Kate Malcolm Historian: Nikolina Uzicainin Membership Chair: Judy Seery Museum Chair: ​Susan Simon Trustees: Maureen Byrne Rebecca Fields                               Herm Huber Virginia Laughlin Jim Malcolm Judy Seery Doug Simon Cathie Coultas  Emerita Dorothy Pietrowski  Emerita History of the Madison Historical Society The Madison Historical Society was founded in 1922 by a group of very civic-minded citizens committed to saving one of the most historic structures in Madison, the Bottle Hill Tavern, that stood on the corner of Main St. and Waverly Place where the Chase Bank now stands. In 1819, Colonel Stephen D. Hunting of the Morris County Militia purchased the original site of the tavern and an inn/tavern was erected on the site and known through the years as the Waverly House, the Madison House, and the Bottle Hill Tavern. In 1825 the Marquis de Lafayette visited the Tavern. Lafayette was a French military officer who served under George Washington in the Continental Army. In 1922 the First National Bank purchased the site where the Bottle Hill Tavern was located for a new building and intended to tear down the old tavern. Led by Mrs. Calvin Anderson, Mrs. Anderson Case, Mrs. Fitshugh C. Speer, Lloyd W. Smith and Arthur W. Buttenheim, a successful fundraising effort was completed to pay for the cost of moving the Tavern to a location further down Main Street. After the move took place in 1923, it became the home for the Historical Society until the late 1940s when the Society moved to the Madison Public Library that now houses the Museum of Early Trades and Crafts. In the late 1950s the historical collection of the Society was for a time homeless and had to be dispersed. Some items went into storage, many were put on permanent loan in local museums and some returned to their donors. Meetings were held in the YMCA. Currently the Historical Society is housed in The Local History Center at the Madison Public Library. Bottle Hill Tavern moved down Main Street in 1922. Sam has almost 50 years of experience in marketing, advertising and media and continues to be actively involved in the business. Before starting Madison in 1988, he worked for 16 years at Sarabhai’s, Cadbury, Contract and Mudra. He is the recipient of AAAI Lifetime Achievement Award, IAA’s Hall of Fame Award and Ad Club of Kolkata’s Hall of Fame Award. Sam Balsara Chairman, Madison World Ajit is an experienced and pedigreed true blue media professional with almost 3 decade experience in Media in India and abroad. He brings a unique blend of creative strategy and commercial acumen. He is a pass out of Xavier’s Institute of Management, Bhubaneshwar. He started his early career in media planning at Madison Media, for 7 years, followed by 13 years at Group M, where he was Managing Director, South Asia at Maxus, CEO Asia Pacific at Maxus and Global President of Wavemaker based in London. He was also the Chief Commercial Officer at ShareChat and prior to rejoining Madison, he was the Head of Revenue – Entertainment & International at JioStar. At JioStar, he was a key voice shaping the future of TV media, Digital, Connected TV, Branded content, and driving brand growth narratives and immersive consumer experiences on the platforms. Ajit Varghese Partner and Group CEO, Madison Media & OOH An IIT Delhi and IIM Kolkata alumni, Vikram has over 38 years’ experience in Marketing (P&G, Coca Cola), Media (Star TV) and Advertising (Mindshare, Group M, Maxus WW, Madison).
Prior to joining Madison World, he held the following positions, Global CEO Maxus Worldwide; Global Strategy Development Officer Group M; CEO GroupM South Asia; CEO Mindshare South Asia.
In terms of current industry positions, he has recently been appointed as the Vice-Chairman at the Media Research Users Council of India (MRUC). Additionally, he serves as the Chairman of the BARC Tech Committee, the IRS Tech Committee, and the IBDF-AAAI sub-committee. He is also the Co-Chairman of the ABC Council, a member of the AAAI Board, and a former President of the Ad Club Bombay. Vikram Sakhuja Executive Director Lara, an alumnus from Harvard Business School has been working at Madison for the last 20 years in various roles. She completed her Master’s in Marketing from Bristol in UK and joined Madison in 2004 as a Management Trainee. She has been instrumental in diversifying the group into newer areas of Communication. She is also in charge of organization building. She has been ranked amongst the Top 50 Most Influential Women in Media by Impact magazine, since the inception of the Report. She is also an Independent Director on Board of Nobel Hygiene Pvt Ltd. Lara Balsara Vajifdar Executive Director, Madison World Vivek Das is a digital transformation leader with over two decades of experience in digital marketing and integrated media. He has led strategic mandates at top agencies including EssenceMediacom, where he oversaw Google’s business across India and Southeast Asia. He has also had leadership roles at Mindshare, VML and FoxyMoron. Vivek brings a sharp digital-first mindset and a proven track record of driving innovation at scale. Vivek Das Chief Digital Officer, Madison Media Vinay has over 25 years of experience having worked at Mindshare 
Fulcrum for over 10 years, where he handled buying for the Unilever 
business. He has also worked with Disney as Director, Revenue Strategy, in addition to having worked at Starcom, HTA and Percept. Vinay Hegde CEO - Investments Vanita started her media agency career with Madison  almost 22 years ago. She today heads a large diverse portfolio of marquee brands in the Mumbai office ranging from McDonald’s, Ceat, Blue Star to Indian Oil, Shaadi.com, Lodha and many others. She has been ranked amongst the Top 50 most influential Women in Media in the country by Impact magazine. Vanita Keswani CEO, Madison Media Sigma Jolene has over 20 years of experience and joined Madison Media in 2016. Over the years, she has played a key role in Madison Media’s Mumbai office and leads clients such as Marico, Bajaj Electricals, Jyothy Labs, amongst others. Jolene Fernandes Solanki Chief Operating Officer, Madison Media Ultra Abhik has overall 17 years of experience and joined Madison Media 
in 2012. Over the years, he has played a key role in Madison Media’s 
Mumbai office to lead accounts such as Asian Paints, Abbott, Cipla Health and Leibherr, amongst others. He has been responsible for making his clients win several awards including Client of the Year." Abhik Banerjee Chief Operating Officer, Madison Media Infinity Dinesh has over 20 years of experience in media having worked with  agencies like Starcom MediaVest and Mudra before joining Madison. Dinesh heads the Agency’s Bangalore office which today works on  accounts like Titan, TVS, Lifestyle and many others. Dinesh Rathod CEO, Madison Media Omega With over 25 years experience in media and communications, Mimi brings a wealth of expertise to her role as COO at Madison Media Plus. Her career includes pivotal roles at leading organizations such as GroupM, Publicis, Universal McCann and Alchemist Group, where she most recently excelled as a Managing Consultant. Mimi’s experience spans FMCG, Lifestyle & Luxury sectors, and Digital-first businesses, working with top clients like Dabur, Perfetti, OLX, Mother Dairy, RSPL, GoDaddy, etc.. She holds an Advanced Management Program degree from XLRI, Jamshedpur, and is a certified trainer. At Madison Media Plus, Mimi leverages her extensive background to drive operational excellence and strategic growth, ensuring the company’s continued success in the dynamic media landscape. Mimi Deb COO, Madison Media Plus Jyothirmayee has been at the forefront of the data & digital marketing revolution in India. She was among the top 5 Facebook developers in India in 2007, and from there on has used her expertise to set-up and scale start-ups and grow businesses. She is an alumnus of PESIT Bangalore and worked in Trilogy Business software, before starting her own entrepreneurial journey. Her true passions are marketing analytics, Angel investing and consulting. Jyothirmayee JT Founder Hiveminds Dipankar has been in Out of Home Industry for last 25 years, having worked with leading agencies like Selvel Vantage group, Portland, Zenith Optimedia. A Madison Group veteran of 20 + years, he has rich experience in handling large AOR clients like Vodafone Idea, Coca Cola, Tata Motors, Essel group and BJP among many others. Dipankar Sanyal CEO, Platinum Outdoor and MRP Deepti has a brand marketing and product management background. She has experience in marketing across FMCG, media and start-ups. She has launched 2 start-ups in India and has created tech products to enhance customer experience in start-ups. She is an alumnus of Indian School of Business, (ISB, Hyderabad). Deepti Bhadauria CEO Hiveminds Jayesh is a computer science graduate, but the lure of Media made him start his career with the OOH industry. He started his working life in Sales with TDI, marketing sites at Airports, but soon thereafter moved to MOMS and soon mastered the art and science of Outdoor Planning and Buying. One of the oldest members of the MOMS team, having joined in 2003, he has handled reputed clients across almost all categories that use OOH. Jayesh focusses on Client Delight and delivers high ROI to his clients which has helped him rise to the position of CEO in MOMS. Jayesh Yagnik CEO, MOMS Outdoor Sunny can best be described as an innovative go-getter who strives to deliver on his promises. He is a “through-the- line practitioner with over 15 years of experience in the field. His expertise spans across all areas of BTL-Events, Activation, Retail, Rural, Radio and Integrated Marketing campaigns. In his last role, he was Head Experiential Marketing for Mindshare. Sunny Vohra CEO, Madison Turnt and Anugrah Madison With more than 19 years of experience in all aspects of the end-to-end creative process, Ramesh has traversed through Radio, TV, Experiential Marketing and Outdoor Media. His problem-solving abilities and eye for detail have earned him a reputation in conceptual and visual breakthroughs. His career trajectory records more than 100 awards across industry platforms. Ramesh Bhaskaran Chief Creative Officer, Madison OOH Sudarshan Karandikar brings over two decades of experience in advertising and marketing, having worked with & led teams at top agencies like Ogilvy, McCann, FCB Interface, SSB&B Lintas, and Dentsu. Specialising in brand identity development, strategic market planning, and IP creation in the music and content space, Sudarshan has led integrated campaigns for major brands across the Automobile, FMCG, and BFSI, including Perfetti (launch of Stop Not), Saffola Masala Oats, Go Air, ICICI Direct, ITC, Nickelodeon, Mahindra Tractors, and LIC. Notably, he was instrumental in the globally awarded “Punishing Signal” campaign for Mumbai Traffic Police, honoured at D&AD and One Show. Sudarshan Karandikar Vice President - Madison Loop A true PR professional, Abhinav has worked in PR agencies and internal and external communications for over 21 years. In his previous roles, he has been part of leadership teams at SPG Group, Avian WE, Edelman India, Comma Consulting and Rediffusion DYR. " Abhinav Srivastava CEO, Madison Public Relations Mr. R Sridhar is a distinguished alumnus of IIM Bangalore with over four decades of experience in the advertising and communication industries. Pravin has held responsible positions in new initiatives, business development, crisis management, team restructuring, account planning, and client servicing. Pravin Shiriyannavar COO, Brandcom PR Melroy has close to 25 years of experience in the sports marketing industry. Melroy Dsouza CEO, Professional Management Group With over 27 years of experience, Chetan is a seasoned finance professional. At Madison World, Chetan excels in managing financial strategy, legal and tax compliance matters and risk management. His extensive experience and strategic insight drive the agency’s continued growth in the competitive media landscape. Chetan Borkar Chief Financial Officer Manish drives success by aligning talent strategies with business goals across all Communication industries. He has partnered with the Boards and Leadership to enhance culture and employee experience. Previously, he co-founded a career coaching firm that guided over 1,000 professionals globally. Recognized with awards such as "Best Employer Brand" and "Most Influential HR Professionals in India,"  he continues to drive the most important element in any Agency, People excellence at Madison World. Manish Menon Vice President, Human Resources Milestones A snapshot of our eventful 35-year old journey. 1988 - March 21: Begins operations as a full service agency with Godrej & Nelco accounts. 1989 to 1994 - 1989: Launched Cinthol Lime which made a phenomenal impact in premium market in first month. - 1994: Tied-up with DMB&B. Added P&G brands Vicks & Whisper. Made Whisper market leader, despite premium pricing. - 1995: Madison Media wins Buying AOR of P&G. 1995 to 1999 - 1995: Madison Media wins Buying AOR of P&G. - 1996: Madison Media wins Buying AOR of Tata Tea and Coca Cola. - 1997: Madison Media wins Buying AOR of Godrej. -1998: Madison Media opens in Delhi. Rural unit, Anugrah Madison begins. Madison Media opens in Bangalore with BPL Group AOR. - 1999: Parts company with DMB&B and lost Cinthol creative account along with Vicks & Whisper accounts. 2000 to 2004 - 2000: Madison Media Retained P&G Buying AOR.
Madison PR starts independent operations
Madison Media wins Maruti (TV) AOR, Perfetti van Melle AOR, Godrej planning AOR. - 2001: New Outdoor unit - MOMS commences operations as independent company. Wins ZEE TV, VIP, Delsey and HBO - 2003: Madison Media wins Kotak Mahindra, Asian Paints, Cadbury AOR. - 2004: New in-film unit (MATES) starts operations. 2005 to 2007 - 2005: Madison Media becomes India’s Most Admired Media Agency, according to the Brand Equity Ad Agency Reckoner 2005. - 2006: Madison Media becomes the first Media agency in India to bring home not one but two Cannes Media Lions Awards for work done on Cadbury and P&G. - 2007: Madison starts a second Outdoor Agency - PLATINUM OUTDOOR. - 2007: Madison forays into  Sports marketing by acquiring a stake in Professional Management Group, India's first Sports Marketing Company founded by Sunil Gavaskar - 2007: Madison Media ranked No.1 Media Agency again by Brand Equity Ad Agency Reckoner 2007! 2008 to 2010 - 2008: Madison Media starts operations in Sri Lanka and wins Airtel and Britannia accounts. - 2008: Sam Balsara acquires a majority stake in WPP's Mediacom operations in India and Mediacom wins P&G's media planning and buying business. - 2008: Madison announces the launch of the second Media Agency PLATINUM MEDIA; to commence operations in the last quarter of 2008. - 2009: Madison World wins at Festival of Media Awards, Valencia – Best Communication Strategy for BBC World Service Trust, Condoms Campaign. - 2009: Madison Media wins 1 Bronze Media Lion Award at Cannes for BBC World Service Trust, Condoms Campaign under Best Use of Mixed Media. - 2010: Madison World launches Madison Digital 2011 to 2014 - 2011: Madison World evolves a 4 pillar strategy of: Automation, Ideation, Digitilization, Diversity. - 2011: Anugrah Madison celebrates its 25th Anniversary. - 2012: Gautam Kiyawat joins Madison Media Group as CEO. - 2012: Madison Media wins Grand Emvie, Media Client of the Year for Cadbury and 8 Golds , 5 Silvers and 2 Bronze. - 2013: Sam Balsara wins IAA Leadership award for Media Agency Head of the Year. - 2013: MADISON WORLD celebrates its Silver Jubilee on March 21, 2013. - 2013: Madison PR awarded 'PR Agency of the Year 2013'. - 2014: Madison Media helps BJP get landslide victory in General Elections. 2015 to 2016 - 2015: Madison Media wins Print Media Agency of Year at E4M Ink Awards 2015. - 2015: Madison Media wins E4M, Media Ace Award’s Media Agency of the Year. - 2015: Vikram Sakhuja joins Madison as Partner and Group CEO Media and OOH. - 2016: Platinum Outdoor wins Tata Motors Outdoor Media AOR. 2017 to 2019 - 2017: Madison World relaunches its experiential marketing unit – Madison TURNT. - 2017: Madison World acquires majority stake in Brandcom PR. - 2017: Madison Media acquires majority stake in performance management digital specialist agency - Hiveminds. - 2019: Madison Media wins back Marico Media AOR - 2019: Madison Media launches DATASK its own data driven marketing and insights platform 2020 to 2024 - 2020: Madison Media amongst the Top 5 Independent Agencies of the World according to Recma - 2020: Madison Turnt launches virtual digital platform, Uplive. - 2021: Madison Digital acquires Kolkata Digital Agency Crows Nest. - 2023: Madison Digital launches creative unit, Madison Loop and Madison BMB merges with Madison Loop Madison appoints Rob Norman as Consultant - Italian eatery a new venture for Madison Social owners News Sports Entertainment Opinion Email Us Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals MONEY Italian eatery a new venture for Madison Social owners TaMaryn Waters Democrat staff writer The Madison Social owners, the same ones who brought you pub fare with a twist, are at it again with a new Italian restaurant called Centrale. Next door to Madison Social in College Town, the Italian parlor opens on Oct. 7 with an old-school, savory menu packed with pasta, pizza and shareable appetizers like fried olives wrapped in sausage. A notable dish is the Porchetta, a pork loin wrapped in Italian herbs commonly served in Italy. Another dish is a buttery pasta pepper dish served in a parmesan cheese bowl. The restaurant's motto: Crazy good food, approachable wines by tap, glass or bottle and a table of friends to share it with. Matt Thompson, co-owner and partner, said the concept for Centrale (which means "center" in Italian) came from his partners Brian and Katie McKenna, who both live in New York. The newlyweds traveled to Italy for their honeymoon. That experience, along with living in a city known for mouth-watering Italian meals, sparked the inspiration for Centrale. The owners turned to a New York chef consultant to develop the menu. "There were so many options in New York City that we just found the ones we really took to and liked and developed the menu from there,” Thompson said. Contact TaMaryn Waters at tlwaters@tallahassee.com or follow @TaMaryn Waters on Twitter. Team Home About Legislative Expertise Government Contracting Small Business Budget & Appropriations Economic Development Cybersecurity Capabilities Federal Advocacy Elevating Businesses Procurement Strategy Outreach & Grassroots Team Contact Home About Legislative Expertise Government Contracting Small Business Budget & Appropriations Economic Development Cybersecurity Capabilities Federal Advocacy Elevating Businesses Procurement Strategy Outreach & Grassroots Team Contact Our Team Elizabeth Sullivan | President Elizabeth Sullivan is the President of Madison Services Group, a woman-owned company that provides government relations and federal business development services. She focuses on federal procurement and small business policy. She has a Masters of Studies in Law (MSL) in Government Procurement and Cybersecurity from the George Washington University School of Law, and was featured in the GW Law Magazine for her role in shaping this new dual degree. She currently leads the policy teams for a group of small and midsize IT value-added resellers, GovEvolve , the leading voice for small and midsize federal contractors - the Montgomery County Chamber of Commerce , and the HUBZone Contractors National Council . She also represents the Women Veterans Business Coalition , Women’s Procurement Circle and GovCon Small Business Coalition . Elizabeth led the formation of the Secure Supply Chain Consortium, a group of small and midsize federal contractors that seek to provide constructive input to decision-makers who are tackling difficult supply chain security problems, such as the implementation of Section 889 and the Department of Defense's Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC).  They are recognized as the driving force behind changes in CMMC 2.0 that were favorable to small businesses. Her expertise in government contracting includes shaping federal acquisition policy on Capitol Hill and analyzing federal procurement data to position companies to win federal contracts. Notably, she has testified before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee on procurement innovation and the role of small and midsize contractors. She has also been featured on procurement panels nationwide, including at the National Contract Management Association (NCMA) World Congress and Women Leaders in Defense and Aerospace Law conference. Elizabeth is a graduate of James Madison University, and holds a master’s degree in Early Childhood Education. Prior to Joining Madison Services Group, Elizabeth was a Teach for America corps member in Chicago, IL. She currently serves as a member of the DC Teach for America Alumni Board and is a member of the NCMA DC Chapter. Ann Sullivan | Founder & Strategic Advisor Ann Sullivan is the Founder of Madison Services Group, Inc. She brings over 40 years of government relations experience in the United States Senate and the House of Representatives, serving in key advisory roles. Ms. Sullivan works with the United States Congress and the Administration to garner national attention for the small and midsize business community. Her expertise includes government procurement, business development programs, healthcare, export development, and tax issues affecting small and midsize businesses. Ann is recognized as the driving force behind implementation of the Small Business Administration's Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) Federal Contract Program and has been a featured keynote speaker and moderator on many procurement panels nationwide. She is recognized around the country for her work to make meaningful policy changes that allow small business to access the federal marketplace. Ann formed the Women Veterans Business Coalition and the Women’s Procurement Circle - policy voices for women-owned businesses. She has also led a small business advisory councils for Fortune 100 companies over her many years in business. Ann specializes in helping elevate the voice of businesses in the federal policy arena - she has helped numerous contractors grow their federal footprint. Ms. Sullivan serves on the Board of Directors for the Montgomery County Chamber of Commerce. She received the Enterprising Women of the Year Award from Enterprising Women Magazine and was honored by Professional Women in Advocacy for Excellence in a Federal Issue Campaign. Ann is also the recipient of three prestigious Stevie® Awards for Women in Business, receiving the top honor in the categories of Lifetime Achievement —Business, Woman of the Year—Business Services, and Communications or PR Campaign of the Year—Public Affairs. She was chosen by Small Business Trends as a Top 100 Small Business Influencer, and the Sunlight Foundation named her as one of Washington’s four “perfectly bipartisan lobbyists.” Ann recently won the “Excellence in a Campaign for Women Serving Women” award from Professional Women in Advocacy. Chris Alsup | Senior Vice President As a Senior Vice President with Madison Services Group, Chris leverages his twenty years of government and corporate experience to assist clients with developing and executing strategies to achieve their federal government objectives. As the Executive Director of GovEvolve, Chris assists federal IT Value Added Resellers (ITVARS) with streamlining the government acquisition process and improving key stakeholders’ awareness of ITVAR-related issues. Chris previously led the North America Government Affairs Team at Dell Technologies in endeavors to promote company priorities among key policymakers. Chris’s team successfully collaborated with executive leaders and internal stakeholders to develop and achieve objectives underlying advocacy efforts. Prior to rejoining Dell in 2016, Chris Alsup served as Chief of Staff for Congressman Michael McCaul (TX-10), now Ranking Member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee. Chris joined Chairman McCaul’s staff after working four years as a Senior Manager in Dell's DC Government Affairs office. Chris previously served eight years with Congressman John Carter (TX-31), the current Ranking Member of the House Military Construction Appropriations Subcommittee. As Chief of Staff, Chris managed the DC and District staff and daily operations of the Chairman’s personal office. In that role, Chris was responsible for collaborating with Committee and Leadership staff, outside interest groups, and Administration personnel to advance the Chairman’s legislative and political agendas. With Dell, Chris developed and advocated policies to promote brand visibility and wellbeing of the company. Chris routinely worked with C-level executives to advantageously engage them in priority issues with relevant policy makers. Chris has also been internally responsible for providing the federal budgetary and policy analysis essential to informing strategic business planning decisions. In Chris’ role as Congressman Carter’s Legislative Director, Chris managed the legislative staff coordinating with district, congressional, and outside entities to advance the Congressman’s legislative agenda. Chris specifically focused on appropriations, foreign affairs, agriculture and military-related policies. Robert Emmett | Vice President Bobby is a government relations professional and licensed attorney with 20 years' experience successfully leading industry and government teams to implement legislative strategies to promote and advance vital commercial aerospace and defense interests. His practice includes daily interaction with Congress, Department of Defense (DoD), aerospace and defense industry partners, trade associations, universities, and related U.S. Government agencies. He is a Washington, D.C. native with an extensive network across the area that include key relationships with House and Senate Appropriations, Armed Services, and Select Intelligence Committees, and Members of Congress. Prior to joining the Madison Services Group team, Bobby worked on Capitol Hill and in the defense and aerospace industry. For six years in the period before and after the September 11 attacks,  he served as a Professional Staff Member for the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI) and was presented the Director of Defense Intelligence award. Later, he transitioned to the private sector in government relations roles for the Goodrich Corporation, United Technologies Corporation, Orbital ATK, and Leidos. He also spent time consulting and representing small defense startups. Working closely with Congress to secure funding and programmatic support, he has helped corporations and clients with appropriations requests. Bobby graduated cum laude from Boston College. He earned his JD from the Georgetown University Law Center, where he participated in the Federal Legislation Clinic and studied government contracting. Amy Emmett | Director, Government Relations Amy is a Director of Government Relations at Madison Services Group. Amy brings almost 15 years of business development, marketing, and advocacy experience to support clients in engaging with the Federal government, enhancing brand reputation, and executing on business goals. Prior to joining MSGI, Amy supported the launch of a government relations function and team for a biopharma company with U.S. headquarters in New Jersey. She served as project manager for Congressional briefings, facility site visits, and issue education events in Washington, D.C. and at headquarters. Collaborating closely with colleagues, she managed and distributed emerging information around healthcare industry issues and regulations through policy research and communications. A key member of an internal review committee, she fielded the advocacy strategy around corporate sponsorships and charitable donations from the government affairs team, and managed the full lifecycle of vendor and budget management for the team. She spent more than seven years executing client development campaigns, supporting client engagement initiatives, and tracking progress against business goals at a global law firm in their headquarters office in Washington, D.C., including over four years supporting the life sciences and health practice groups. Earlier in her career, she also managed the marketing and communications function for the four Washington, D.C. region offices of a global commercial real estate firm. She spent almost two years developing, producing, and submitting Federal government contract proposals for a mid-size IT, professional services, and defense contractor. Committed to driving positive change and serving as a dedicated community volunteer in Washington, D.C., and the Capitol Hill neighborhood, she is involved with the Junior League of Washington, among other groups. Amy attended The University of North Carolina, where she majored in Political Science. Lin Stuart | Director, Women's procurement circle As the Director of the Women’s Procurement Circle, Lin serves with a significant background in logistics and program experience. With a foundation as a business owner for 11 years, Lin understands the needs and challenges that women business owners face. For the past 20 years, Lin has worked with women business owners both domestically and internationally to facilitate programs and training that allow women business owners to successfully grow and thrive, particularly in the federal contracting arena. Weekly Average Effective Annual Yield: 12.13% Madison Group Madison Group Life Assurance General Insurance Investment Managers Corporate Profile Board of Directors Management Madison Group Limited is a locally owned financial services holding company that specializes in Insurance and wealth management services. The Group comprises of Madison Life Assurance Kenya Limited, Madison General Insurance Kenya Limited, and Madison Investment Managers Limited. Madison Life Assurance Kenya was originally incorporated under Kenyan Laws in 1988 as Madison Insurance Company Limited (MICK) after a successful merger between Crusader Plc (1974) and Kenya Commercial Insurance Corporation. The Company has grown exponentially from combined Gross written premiums of KES 100m in 1988 to combined Gross written premiums of KES 6.2 Billion as at Dec 2017. In 2018, MICK demerged into two separate companies – Madison General and Madison Life. Madison Life Assurance now underwrites life assurance business only while Madison General underwrites general insurance business. MADISON GROUP Mission To lead in innovative insurance services that creates and protects wealth for all our stakeholders and to practice good corporate governance. Values Teamwork Integrity Service Initiative Innovativeness Professionalism Samuel G. Ngaruiya Chairman James Wainaina Deputy Chair Edgar Kalya Director Dr. Eustace Mwarania Director Audrey W. Waita Alternate Director Samuel G. Ngaruiya Chairman He is a holder of Bachelor of Arts Degree from the Robert Schumann University, France and an MBA from the University of Nairobi. He is also a holder of a Diploma in Marketing from the Chartered Institute of Marketing, London. He holds several Directorships and is currently the Chairman and Managing Director of Madison Group Ltd and the Chairman of Amedo Centres Kenya Limited. Mr. Ngaruiya has held various senior management level positions in diverse sectors in Kenya including in the oil sector, the motor vehicle sector, the newsprint media sector and in the manufacturing sector James Wainaina Deputy Chair Mr. Wainaina holds a Master of Business Administration degree from Maastricht School of Management/ESAMI, Fellow of Chartered Association of Certified Accountants-UK (FCCA), member of the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Kenya (ICPAK), member of the Institute of Certified Secretaries of Kenya (ICSK) and a member of Kenya Institute of Management. He is the Executive Deputy Chairman of Madison Group Limited together with its subsidiaries, prior to which he worked as Managing Director, Amedo Centres Kenya Limited. He holds several other directorships in Kenya. Edgar Kalya Director Edgar Kalya has an MBA (Finance) from the University of Nairobi; Certificate in Corporate Governance by the Centre for Corporate Governance (CCG); Advanced Management Program (AMP 2012) from Strathmore Business School, IESE Business School in Barcelona Spain, and Lagos Business Schools; honorary member of the International Academy of Retail Banking in London; and Associate of the Chartered Institute of Bankers ‐ ACIB (London). He is a former Director at Barclays Bank and NIC Bank capping a banking and consulting career spanning over 25 years. He consults in Strategy, Corporate Governance, Finance, Investments, Leadership, Business Advisory, Restructuring, Business Models, and stakeholder management. Edgar sits in the boards of Madison Group, Madison Life, Madison General, Madison Investment Managers, and Talentplex Holdings Ltd. He is a mentor and Coach using his knowledge to develop the next generation of industry leaders. Dr. Eustace Mwarania Director Dr. Mwarania obtained Doctor of Philosophy in Electronics from the University of Southampton 1992.  After a brief stint as a lecturer in the University of Nairobi, he left to develop programs that enhanced usage of ICT applications for many businesses and public bodies in Kenya. Upon operationalization of the PPP Act, 2013 Dr. Mwarania started developing infrastructure projects under this framework. He is the Founder and Chairman of Trapos Limited, a Pan‐African firm specializing in the development of urban cable car projects to decongest city roads. Their first project, Likoni cable express, was the first privately initiated investment proposal to receive full concession approval in Kenya. Audrey W. Waita Alternate Director Audrey is an Alternate Director to Mr James M. Wainaina. She is Advocate of the High Court of Kenya and currently serves as a consultant in corporate, commercial and conveyancing matters.    Her professional experience includes serving as an independent consultant for the Kenya Information and Communications Technology Board, Group Legal Counsel with Linksoft Group Ltd. and in-house counsel with Safaricom Limited, among other roles. Audrey holds an LLB. and an LLM degree in International  Business Law from the University of Manchester – UK.  She also holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Law from the College of Law of England and Wales- UK and Post Graduate Diploma in Law from the Kenya School of Law. Prof. lraki has also served as Lead Consultant in a number of high profile projects in Kenya and internationally. He was a research fellow with the National Economic and Social Council (NESC) for 3 years. He is a columnist and commentator on socio-economic policies in the Kenyan media. He is a PhD and Fulbright Scholar in Economics and Management-Jackson State University Mississippi, USA. Prof. lraki also holds an MBA from the University of Nairobi, M. Ed (Science) from Kenyatta University and B. Ed (Science from the same university. He also holds a certificate in global journalism from the University of Toronto, Canada.
